definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)

sentences.english: Roderigo defied the old gentleman and refused to stir.
sentences.chinese: 羅特克還敢公然反抗那個老紳士，拒絕從命。

sentences.english: He spoke out against the excesses of King Edward II.
sentences.chinese: 他公然反對國王愛德華二世的暴政。

sentences.english: The suspect who fled was arrested on suspicion of being drunk in public and resisting arrest.
sentences.chinese: 逃走的那名嫌犯因涉嫌公然酗酒及拒捕而遭到逮捕。

sentences.english: When his youngest son, whom he loved most defied him, his face turned purple with anger.
sentences.chinese: 當他最寵愛的小兒子公然反抗他時，他氣得臉色發青。

sentences.english: It is illegal for men to be seen publicly in any kind of strapless gown.
sentences.chinese: 男性被公然見到穿著任何無肩帶禮服是違法的。

sentences.english: There are many reasons why people don't speak out against injustice.
sentences.chinese: 人們不能公然反對不公正是有許多原因的。

sentences.english: Even cosmopolitan liberals are unabashedly disdainful of their southern neighbours.
sentences.chinese: 甚至蒙古世界性的自由主義者也公然蔑視他們的南鄰。

sentences.english: The student disobeyed the headmaster to they eye.
sentences.chinese: 那學生公然違背校長的命令。

sentences.english: They are defiant and require a tremendous amount of our attention.
sentences.chinese: 他們公然違反紀律，需要我們付出極大的關注。

sentences.english: They flout the most basic laws protecting the rights of workers.
sentences.chinese: “他們公然無視保護勞工權利的最基本法規”。

sentences.english: Those who publicly overstep the mark by their ostentation .
sentences.chinese: 那些到處賣弄公然逾越社交規範的人。

sentences.english: Only Inez has the courage to speak out against him.
sentences.chinese: 只有伊內茲有勇氣去公然反對他。

sentences.english: Reach " barefaced affront other is concoctive perhaps the fact is calumniatory other " wait for case.
sentences.chinese: 及“公然侮辱他人或者捏造事實誹謗他人”等情形。

sentences.english: Facing such an outright sexual harassment, the student found herself in a dilemma.
sentences.chinese: 該女博士生面對這種公然的性騷擾，感到進退兩難。

sentences.english: Our Corporate leaders are without patriotism and are open traitors to America.
sentences.chinese: 我們的企業領導人毫無愛國節操，公然背叛美國。

sentences.english: That would be interpreted as us saying we don't care about developing people.
sentences.chinese: 這會被解讀爲我們公然宣稱毫不在乎員工培養。

definition: see 冒大不韙|冒大不韪[mao4 da4 bu4 wei3]
pinyin: mao4 tian1 xia4 zhi1 da4 bu4 wei3

definition: overt/to make no secret (of one's presence)/grandiose/with great scope
to criticize harshly/to denounce/to attack viciously
variant of 污衊|污蔑[wu1 mie4]
(of a person) honorable/not devious/(of a behavior) fair and aboveboard/without tricks/openly/(of a situation) out in the open
to dare (negative connotation)/to have the audacity to (do sth)
